etymology.description: 拉(pull) + 制(make/manufacture) = manufacturing by pulling/drawing metal through a die.
etymology.interpretation: Names a metalworking method where material is pulled through a die to reduce cross-section and improve surface finish. Commonly used to produce wire, rods, and precision tubes.
etymology.simplification: 製 → 制 per PRC character simplification to reduce strokes and unify forms; 拉 unchanged.

parts.english: to pull; to draw; to drag; to tug
to make; to manufacture; to regulate; system

examples.chinese: 我们用拉制工艺生产细金属丝(我們用拉製工藝生產細金屬絲)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yòng lāzhì gōngyì shēngchǎn xì jīnshǔ sī.
examples.english: We use the drawing process to produce fine metal wire.

examples.chinese: 在拉制过程中(在拉製過程中)，材料被连续通过拉模以减小截面(材料被連續通過拉模以減小截面)。
examples.pinyin: Zài lāzhì guòchéng zhōng, cáiliào bèi liánxù tōngguò lāmú yǐ jiǎnxiǎo jiémiàn.
examples.english: During drawing, the material is pulled continuously through a die to reduce its cross-section.

examples.chinese: 与挤压相比(與擠壓相比)，拉制更适合制造高精度细管(拉製更適合製造高精度細管)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ jǐyā xiāngbǐ, lāzhì gèng shìhé zhìzào gāo jīngdù xìguǎn.
examples.english: Compared with extrusion, drawing is better suited for making high-precision thin tubes.
